fields.description:
Blackstone’s people are the firm’s most valuable asset and are critical to our success as a highly respected asset management and advisory firm.  Over the years, Blackstone has been a magnet for some of the most talented professionals in our industry.  We seek qualified candidates who believe, as we do, that intellectual capital is the driving force in creating economic value.

Blackstone provides a wide range of work experience and learning opportunities through our asset management businesses, which include the management of our private equity funds, real estate funds, hedge fund solutions, credit oriented funds and closed-end mutual funds; and our various advisory services businesses (including financial and strategic advisory, restructuring and reorganization advisory and fund placement advisory services).
fields.name: Blackstone

fields.description:
Broadway Technology is a leading provider of advanced high-performance financial trading solutions for electronic fixed income markets. Our proprietary software platform is an open, flexible, complete solution for screen and automated trading operations of any size and complexity. We've delivered some of the world’s most advanced trading systems to premier global banks, proprietary trading groups, and hedge funds. Our software manages billions of dollars in transactions across five continents daily.

 

We hire developers who thrive on building the most advanced technology. We take a rapid, methodical approach to development, and we focus on creating solutions that solve our clients’ immediate needs, yet can evolve and scale as needs change.

 

We also believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and we understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed.
fields.name: Broadway Technology

fields.description:
At Dropbox, we want to change the way people think about data and what's possible with technology. Whether you're using a computer, smartphone, iPad, camera, TV, car, or other device, you should have access to all of your data without having to think about it. Founded by Drew Houston ('05) and Arash Ferdowsi ('08 dropout), over half of Dropbox's 30 engineers are from MIT.

 

Here are a few reasons why us MIT grads (and dropouts) really enjoy working at Dropbox:

  • You actually apply concepts from 6.172, 6.824, 6.828, 6.830, 6.831, 6.857 (and much more), to solving a new space of problems for 40 million people and counting.
  • People think like you do-- that is to say, we're hardcore about precision, thoroughness, and correctness.
  • In 6.033, we debated if Worse is Better. At Dropbox, we believe Better is Better, and that it's possible to hold your work to an even higher standard of combining practicality, correctness, and simplicity.
  • This is a place where people obsess over and take pride in the quality of their work-- almost more than they should!
  • Dropbox makes it so the hardest problems you've ever worked on aren't just the ones at MIT.

 

Each of these Dropbox projects required just one MIT engineer:

  • built and released our Linux client
  • scaled the servers to handle millions of concurrent connections
  • built and have scaled the analytics system end-to-end
  • reverse-engineered the OS X Finder for integration
  • built and released the iPhone app
  • build and released the mobile version of the website, then re-built from scratch (both times an intern project!)
  • ... and much, much more

 

We've just started building the file system of the world and are going to need your help. You belong here.
fields.name: Dropbox

fields.description: ExxonMobil is the world's premier petroleum and petrochemicals company.  Our Upstream Division finds, develops, and produces crude oil and natural gas in over 50 countries.  Our Downstream Division produces and markets some 8 million barrels per day of gasoline and other refined products under the Esso, Mobil and Exxon brands in over 190 countries.  As global energy demand rises, we need your creative energy to find ways to meet it.  Ways that support economic, environmental, and social progress according to our core values:  discipline, integrity, reliability, and a commitment to technology.  The world faces enormous energy challenges.  This is where you come in, because the biggest challenges attract the best.  Join ExxonMobil in tackling the world's toughest energy challenges!
fields.name: Exxon Mobil

fields.description:
A Fidelity internship is more than a summer job. Building your resume, networking, and gaining relevant work experience are just a few benefits of participating in a paid internship or co-op at Fidelity Investments. Our goal is provide interns experiences that will take you far beyond the classroom and top performers may be offered full-time employment upon graduation. 

With multiple U.S. locations, we offer a range of opportunities with significant work assignments for undergraduate and graduate students. Co-ops, which are full-time positions lasting between four and six months, may also be available for college credit. While most of our internships and co-ops are offered in the summer, year-round opportunities may also be available. Positions may support a direct business unit or function or be a precursor to a formalized program and are available for both undergrad and graduate students. We can help provide the foundation for a lasting career.
fields.name: Fidelity

fields.description: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and high-net-worth individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Hong Kong and other major financial centers around the world.
fields.name: Goldman Sachs

fields.description:
“Google is organized around the ability to attract and leverage the talent of exceptional technologists and business people."

- Larry Page, Google Co-founder and CEO

 

At Google, you will find smart people, big challenges, and opportunities to make a real difference in the world. Engineers at Google are key players in our daily innovation, and we are looking for the brightest minds to join these teams. Opportunities are available to work on Search, Ads, Chrome, Commerce, Infrastructure, Mobile, Social, YouTube, and other exciting projects. 
 
Discover Google news and updates especially for students at googleforstudents.blogspot.com and follow us on Twitter at www.twitter.com/googlestudents.
fields.name: Google

fields.description:
What is J.P. Morgan?

J.P. Morgan is a leading global investment bank with one of the largest client bases in the world, including corporations, governments, states, municipalities, healthcare organizations, education institutions, banks and investors. We operate in more than 100 countries and offer a complete range of financial services to help clients achieve their goals.  We provide strategic advice, lend money, raise capital, help manage risk, and extend liquidity, and hold global leadership positions in all of our major business lines.     
 
Across our business, our goal is to help clients succeed, contribute to orderly and well functioning markets, and support global economic growth. One of the most important functions we serve is extending credit to companies to help them grow.
 
 
What does J.P. Morgan look for?
The work is fastpaced, demanding and intellectually stimulating. We look for candidates with excellent quantitative, analytical and communication skills. You must have the ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlines, and have the aptitude to synthesize large amounts of information and develop innovative solutions. You should also be adaptable, able to manage projects independently and ready to assume a high level of responsibility as a member of a team. A well-rounded academic background with coursework in finance or economics is recommended. Candidates must demonstrate academic strength – a minimum 3.2 GPA for juniors and a minimum 3.5 GPA for freshmen and sophomores, strong teamwork, communication skills and a high energy level.
 
An aptitude for numbers is a must, even if you’re a liberal arts major. If you don’t have a strong financial or business background, be sure you can tell your story; be able to demonstrate your quantitative aptitude, both scholastically and practically (previous work experience, for example) and be ready to articulate how your background will enhance your career at J.P. Morgan.
fields.name: J.P. Morgan

fields.description:
Microsoft is the worldwide leader in software, services and solutions that help people and businesses realize their full potential.  We're motivated and inspired by how our customers and partners use our software to find creative solutions to business problems, develop breakthrough ideas and stay connected to what's important to them. 

 
We run our company in much the same way. Our employees come as they are and do what they love.  We’re a global company, located in over 100 countries, but we often act like a startup. We do software — but we also do hardware, services, research, and community outreach. We work hard, but we value work/life balance, and each of us defines what that means to us. So why not explore what we do, where we do it, and what life is really like at Microsoft? You just might be surprised.
fields.name: Microsoft

fields.description:
With offices in 50+ cities across 25 countries, Oliver Wyman is a leading global management consulting firm that combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, organizational transformation, and leadership development.  The firm's 3,000 professionals help clients optimize their businesses, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities.

 
Oliver Wyman is a rapidly growing, entrepreneurial organization committed to building a dynamic environment full of individuals who share our passion for delivering results for our clients. The work you will do at Oliver Wyman has real impact. As a consultant, you will be charged with responsibility for finding new and meaningful perspectives on some of the toughest problems.
 
Consultants on the Financial Services track specialize in the industry and become content experts early in their careers, which affords high responsibility. Financial services is one of the largest and most dynamic industries in the world. Strategic challenges in retail banking, investment banking, trading, insurance, asset management, the new regulatory environment and risk represent the largest sampling of financial services project work.  Primary practice areas for this group, includes Corporate & Institutional Banking, Retail & Business Banking, Wealth & Asset Management, Insurance, Finance & Risk, Corporate Finance & Advisory, Strategic IT & Operations, and Public Policy.
fields.name: Oliver Wyman

fields.description: Oracle provides the world’s most complete, open, and integrated business software and hardware systems. With the full software and hardware portfolio at its disposal, only Oracle designs and integrates everything from the semiconductor chip to the entire software stack to achieve performance levels that are unmatched in the industry.
fields.name: Oracle

fields.description: Susquehanna International Group (SIG) is a world-leading technology-empowered financial trading firm. Founded in 1987, SIG has grown from an options trading firm on the Philadelphia Stock Exchange to one of the world’s largest privately held financial institutions. Today, with offices around the world, the firm trades virtually every major financial product and is recognized for its disciplined and quantitative trading approach, as well as its leading-edge trading systems. SIG’s structured Development Programs introduce university hires to its unique approach to decision making and prepare them to become independent thinkers within a collaborative environment.
fields.name: Susquehanna International Group

fields.description:
Tesla Motors designs and manufactures the most advanced electric vehicles and electric powertrains in the world. We do not compromise on innovation, performance, or appeal. Nor do we compromise our commitment to hiring and developing the best from around the world.


We work in small, focused teams which, much like our products, are agile, efficient, and focused on excellence. We are driven by work that contributes to a global impact and are passionate about our future in the automotive industry. The pace is fast, the work is stimulating, structure is limited, and innovation is expected. 

Do you question tradition and constantly think of ways to improve status quo? Do you thrive in environments where brilliance is common and challenge is the norm? Are you excited by challenge because you’re amongst the best in your field? If so, you’d be in good company at Tesla Motors.
fields.name: Tesla Motors

fields.description: Thomson Reuters is the world’s leading source of intelligent information for businesses and professionals. The firm combines industry expertise with innovative technology to keep leading decision makers in the financial, legal, scientific, media and other sectors informed and up-to-date. Its variety of internships and full-time opportunities allow students to step into the challenging and fast-paced environment of a truly global organization. Those that do will be encouraged to engineer fresh solutions to problems old as well as new and will find that at Thomson Reuters, there are no limits on where creative thinking and a willingness to learn takes bright minds.
fields.name: Thomson Reuters

fields.description: Tower Research Capital LLC, a high-frequency proprietary trading firm founded in 1998, continues to enhance the in-house trading system that has positioned the firm as a leader in the thriving field of quantitative trading. Today, Tower’s robust, resilient, and blindingly fast system enables the firm to execute algorithmic trading strategies based on patterns in market behavior. While Tower offers challenges and rewards rivaling those of any Wall Street firm, Tower’s laid-back work environment reflects the premium the firm places on quality of life.
fields.name: Tower Research Capital

fields.description:
UBS is a global firm providing services to private, corporate and institutional clients. Its strategy is to focus on international wealth management and the Swiss banking business alongside its global expertise in investment banking and asset management. In Switzerland, UBS is the market leader in retail and commercial banking. UBS’s Investment Bank provides securities and other financial products and research in equities, fixed income, rates, foreign exchange and precious metals. It also provides advisory services as well as access to the world's capital markets for corporate, institutional, intermediary and alternative asset management clients.

The UBS Sales & Trading Summer Internship Program lasts 10 weeks and begins in June. This rotational program across the Securities Division grants interns the opportunity for exposure to a variety of products and areas.  In addition to the experience and education acquired on the job, interns will participate in educational seminars, weekly classes, networking events, and a division-wide speaker series which allows our interns insight to various areas of the bank. The UBS summer internship program content will build awareness of the UBS culture and strategy, develop behavioral skills and provide opportunities to network with peers and senior leaders.
fields.name: UBS

fields.description: Umeqo is an innovative recruiting resource for students and employers to discover one another by leveraging the familiar paradigms of resumes and events. The platform empowers employers to easily filter and search student profiles, create resume books, reach out to candidates, and post and manage campus events. Within minutes, students can create their easy-to-maintain profile, find and RSVP to employer events, and subscribe to employers of their choosing for future event updates.
fields.name: Umeqo

fields.description:
Weiss Asset Management manages over $1 billion combining a value-based, quantitative strategy with econometric analysis of data. Trades are made throughout the world; the countries in which we have traded range from Vietnam, South Africa, and Ukraine to the United Kingdom, Switzerland and France. The Founder, President and Chief Investment Officer, Andrew Weiss, is an Emeritus Professor of economics who works closely with all WAM employees and interns. Our team includes people with advanced training in economics, computer science, physics, law, and mathematics, but we welcome applications from truly exceptional individuals with other backgrounds.

 
At Weiss Asset Management, we do things a little differently. We don’t believe in hierarchy. New hires will work alongside the founder and CIO and other senior staff. They are often assisted by interns. We encourage questions and discussions. If you want to hide in an office, this is not the firm for you. If you want to be intellectually challenged by extremely able coworkers, you will enjoy working for us.
 
The team is a group of exceptionally intelligent high achievers, whose academic backgrounds include economics, engineering, mathematics, physics, political science, computer science and law. Many of our professionals have degrees in two or more of these fields, and have earned graduate degrees from leading universities including Stanford, Caltech, MIT and Harvard. They rarely have backgrounds in finance. 
 
Weiss is looking for highly intelligent and self-motivated interns who want to work in an intellectually challenging environment. We are currently hiring top talent for paid part-time internships in operations, programming, and research. Interns work with analysts, traders, and software developers to research investments, support trading and settlement processes, develop in-house financial software, and maintain existing proprietary software. Interns may have an opportunity for full-time employment after graduation and will have tremendous growth potential, as they will be joining a small and growing team with a superb track record and great potential for continued future successes. Demonstrated, strong quantitative skills are required. Programming ability is a plus. Must be available at least 15 hours per week during the school year. Full-time availability during the winter break and summer vacation is a plus.  Candidates should have experience and interest in econometrics, statistics, computer science, or other quantitative field.
fields.name: Weiss Asset Management
